description: NBC News’ Gaza crew was filming at the Nasser Medical Complex in Khan Younis and caught the heartbreaking scenes as mothers wept over the bodies of their children, killed in an Israeli airstrike earlier in the day.
title: ‘Take me with you, my beloved’: Gazan mother’s plea to her dead son

description: The World Food Programme said more than 200,000 people have crossed into Syria from Lebanon in recent weeks amid Israel's bombardment in southern Lebanon. Many of those who have fled are Syrian nationals and were forced to cross on foot after a highway between the main border crossing was bombed.
title: ' A dangerous milestone': More than 200,000 people flee Lebanon to Syria

description: Haiti’s foreign minister blasted a policy announced last week by neighboring Dominican Republic to deport tens of thousands of migrants back to Haiti, where gang violence is fueling a devastating humanitarian crisis.
title: Haiti condemns Dominican Republic’s plan to deport 10,000 migrants weekly

description: North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un said his country will speed up steps toward becoming a military superpower with nuclear weapons.
title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un wants to speed up becoming a nuclear superpower

description: Chinese stocks were strong today, up more than 10%, but quickly fizzled as investors and traders questioned where the Chinese economy is going. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing on the outlook for one of the strongest economies in the world.
title: China is confident in achieving its economic growth target this year

description: Zheng Shanjie, chairman of China’s National Development and Reform Commission, on Tuesday pledged a raft of actions to bolster the country’s economy during a highly-anticipated press conference.
title: China state planner lays out further actions to boost economy but no new plans for major stimulus

description: Five Russian climbers who have been missing on Nepal's Mount Dhaulagiri since the weekend were found dead on the world’s seventh tallest mountain, their hiking company said on Tuesday.
title: Russian climbers die on Nepal’s Dhaulagiri peak, hiking company says

description: John J. Hopfield was awarded the honor alongside Geoffrey E. Hinton, a British-Canadian professor at the  University of Toronto, in Canada.
title: Princeton physicist wins physics Nobel for pioneering AI research

description: Drone video showed the extent of damage caused by Israeli strikes in the village of Yaroun in southwestern Lebanon. Israel announced it is expanding its operations in the ongoing conflict with Hezbollah.
title: Drone video shows the destruction from Israeli strikes in a Lebanese village

description: Palestinians told an NBC News team in northern Gaza's Jabaliya refugee camp that intense Israeli bombardments were forcing them to leave the area. For some, it was the tenth time they had been displaced since Israel's war with Hamas began.
title: Palestinians flee Gaza's Jabaliya camp amid intense Israeli bombardment

description: The day after rockets were fired at Israel from Lebanon and Gaza, Israel issued an evacuation warning to residents and tourists along a stretch of the coastline near to be the Israeli border. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga has the details on Early Today.
title: Israel issues an evacuation warning along Lebanon’s southern coast

description: There is no sign Iran has decided to build a nuclear weapon and if it did, the U.S. could likely detect such a decision quickly, CIA Director William Burns said.
title: There is no evidence Iran is rushing toward building a nuclear weapon, CIA director says

description: Some Israeli troops sounded the alarm for a potential Hamas attack, but it was ignored in what has now been called Israel's greatest intelligence failure. NBC News' Richard Engel speaks with an IDF soldier who says she warned about the October 7 attack.
title: IDF soldier says she warned of Hamas attack on Oct. 7
